parameter.name: e
parameter.description: Concession rate

parameter.name: min
parameter.description: Minimum utility

parameter.name: max
parameter.description: Maximum utility

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: concession factor unused

parameter.name: Ppareto
parameter.description: chance to offer pareto bid

parameter.name: averageOver
parameter.description: bids to average over to determine concession

parameter.name: niceFactor
parameter.description: how to weigh opponent concessions

parameter.name: Pconcede
parameter.description: chance to concede a bit

parameter.name: concedeFactor
parameter.description: amount to concede

parameter.name: concedeSteps
parameter.description: how many steps it takes to concede

parameter.name: discount
parameter.description: whether to adapt strategy to discounts

parameter.name: phase2
parameter.description: when to start phase 2?

parameter.name: phase3
parameter.description: when to start phase 3?

parameter.name: hardcodefix
parameter.description: hardcode fix issues phase 2

parameter.name: t
parameter.description: If time greater than t, then accept

parameter.name: a
parameter.description: Accept when the opponent's utility * a + b is greater than the utility of our current bid

parameter.name: b
parameter.description: Accept when the opponent's utility * a + b is greater than the utility of our current bid

parameter.name: timeWindow
parameter.description: how big is the time window in which to search for our/his best/worst bids? [=timeWindow]

parameter.name: capWorstSlope
parameter.description: the slope from t=0 to t=1 with which to cap our worst bid utility [=capWorstSlope]

parameter.name: capWorstMinimal
parameter.description: the minimal value that our worst utility should be, otherwise capped [=capWorstMinimal]

parameter.name: acceptCurveStart
parameter.description: the starting value of the accept curve if type == 1. Otherwise, this is the percentage between 1.0 and the value the curve has to approach that the curves starts at. If 0.8 and type is 3 (kalai), then start is 0.8 + 0.2 * kalai [=acceptCurveStart]

parameter.name: acceptCurveApproach
parameter.description: the value that the accept curve will approach if type == 1 [=acceptCurveApproach]

parameter.name: acceptCurveType
parameter.description: 1 = static, surve simply reaches the 'acceptCurveApproach' value and starts at 'acceptCurveStart'. 2 = curve approach avg of 1.0 and first bid opponent. 3 = curve approach kalai. 4 = curve approach nash. [=acceptCurveType]

parameter.name: percentDurationWeight
parameter.description: how much the duration of the last bid weighs in with the current running average [=percentDurationWeight]

parameter.name: panicConcede
parameter.description: amount of utility we allow ourself to concede from opponents best bid during panic mode (from time window) [=panicConcede]

parameter.name: panicWhenBidsLeft
parameter.description: amount of bids left after which we should panic and accept ASAP [=panicWhenBidsLeft]

parameter.name: a
parameter.description: Accept when the opponent's utility * a + b is greater than the utility of our current bid

parameter.name: b
parameter.description: Accept when the opponent's utility * a + b is greater than the utility of our current bid

parameter.name: c
parameter.description: If utility of opponent's bid greater than c, then accept

parameter.name: l
parameter.description: The learning coefficient determines how quickly the issue weights are learned

parameter.name: t
parameter.description: Time after which the OM should not be updated
